messages.message:
Hello team,
We have added some improvements to the sandbox auto-hibernation procedures that take care of hibernating sandboxes that have not seen any platform activity in the last 4 hours.

Please see the notes in the thread below :arrow_down:
cc @shaunak @Aaron Tami

*Don't we already have auto-hibernation?*
Yes - but these improvements mean that auto-hibernation will be more strict as usage metrics are picked more reliably from our observability tools.

*What is considered platform activity?*
• Login attempts
• Actions that interact with FileService
If you're using you sandbox to dev/test changes outside of the IB platform (ie. infra, observability, etc.) please make sure to login and navigate the platform to trigger some activity. As we make more improvements to the activity tracking, we'll make sure to cover these cases.

*Does this mean I no longer have to manually hibernate my sandbox?*
No - sandboxes should always be hibernated manually when the owner knows it will no longer be used for a period of time. Additionally, if a sandbox is no longer needed, it should be destroyed.

*Can my sandbox be exempt from auto-hibernation?*
We review these on a case by case basis. Please provide sandbox name, use case and timeframe where the box should be exempt. Owners of these boxes are responsible of hibernating the sandbox manually when not in use.

*I believe my sandbox was hibernated unexpectedly, even after triggering some activity*
Please post on <#C01N7DV1137|> and we'll look at your box to understand what caused the auto hibernation. We're trying to continuously improve the activity tracking. If your box runs critical workloads, see the message about exemption (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C06FA6A23/p1673536848998649?thread_ts=1673536826.448999&cid=C06FA6A23) above.

*Why do sandboxes need to be hibernated automatically?*
Sandboxes contribute a large portion of our cloud spending. Hibernating sandboxes when not in use ensure we maximize cloud savings.
*Please share any feedback you might have below* :arrow_down:
